p: Different final concentrations of LPS (5, 10, and 15 μg/mL) were added to the cells and incubated for 12, 24, 48, and 72 h, respectively. The cell viability was detected by an MTT assay. As shown in Figure 2, LPS significantly decreased the cell viability of HCoEpiCs compared with the control group ( P < 0.05), only except LPS (5 μg/mL incubated for 24 h). Again, compared with the LPS (5 μg/mL) group, the differences in LPS (10 μg/mL) group or LPS (15 μg/mL) group were significant ( P < 0.05) except incubated for 12 h. But, there was no difference between the LPS (10 μg/mL) group and LPS (15 μg/mL) group ( P > 0.05). So, we chose LPS (10 μg/mL) to induce inflammatory injury of HCoEpiC in this study.
